member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.SamsungSmartTv
member.summary: The Samsung Smart TV symbol enables a Samsung Smart TV to used as an On Screen Display (OSD) for a Crestron System. The Samsung Smart TV symbol is programmed to run in conjunction with a specialized Crestron application developed exclusively for the Samsung Smart TV.The application runs in the background while content plays on the Samsung Smart TV;various alerts and notifications programmed, overlay themselves directly over the content playing.The application is designed to be compatible with all Samsung 2012 Series Smart TVs or later.The OSD features a root menu consisting of up to six list items; each item can have an optional submenu.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.SamsungSmartTvAppControl.ShowCurrentSourceSubpage
member.summary: Shows the Current Source Popup. The Current Source Popup will always show up on the top left of the screen. The text shown in the subpage should be set before the alert is shown via the Current Source signal. If the text contained in the Current Source string is longer than what can fit on the subpage, the text will be truncated and an ellipses will be shown.
member.remarks: True/1 = show Current Source Subpage; False/0 = no effect.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.SamsungSmartTvAppControl.ShowTextAlertSubpage
member.summary: Shows the Text Alert Popup. The location of the text alert popup can be configured by the Text Alert Location signal. The text shown in the alert should be set before the alert is shown via the Text Alert Message signal. The text alert subpage will scroll the string contained Text Alert Message for as long as Show Text Alert Subpage is asserted.
member.remarks: True/1 = show Text Alert Subpage; False/0 = no effect.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedDisplayV2
member.summary:
The RoomView Connected Display symbol allows any projector that integrates with RoomView to connect directly to the control system, where it can be controlled even without RoomView interaction. The symbol can be used with any projector that displays the Crestron logo. Using the projector's built-in Web page or on-screen display on some models. The following parameters must be configured on the projector: 1) the IP address of the control system; 2) the IP ID assigned in SIMPL Windows; and 3) the port number (default 41794).
This class will trigger event.

member.summary:
Indicates that the projector is warming up. This property is supported by Crestron Connected AVR V2.
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: The progress of the warm up time is reported by . Some projectors are locked out during warm up.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedDisplayV2.CCPower.CCWarmUpCoolDown.CoolingDownFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the projector is cooling down. This property is supported by Crestron Connected AVR V2.
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: The progress of the cool-down time is reported by . Some projectors are locked out during cool-down.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedDisplayV2.CCPower.CCWarmUpCoolDown.WarmingUpProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the progress of projector warm up from 0% to 100%. This property is supported by Crestron Connected AVR V2. Use "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.PercentToUshort" to convert the percentage to a ushort value or "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToPercent" to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedDisplayV2.CCPower.CCWarmUpCoolDown.CoolingDownProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the progress of projector cool down progress from 100% to 0%. This property is supported by Crestron Connected AVR V2. Use "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.PercentToUshort" to convert the percentage to a ushort value or "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToPercent" to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.Play
member.summary: Starts playback.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.Pause
member.summary: Pauses playback.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.SkipForward
member.summary: Moves to the next track/media item.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.SkipReverse
member.summary: Moves to the previous track/media item.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.FastForward
member.summary: Moves the position within the current track forward, for as long as the input is high.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.FastReverse
member.summary: Moves the position within the current track in reverse, for as long as the input is high.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.ThumbsUp
member.summary: Gives "Thumbs Up" (positive) feedback to the track/media item currently playing.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.ThumbsDown
member.summary: Gives "Thumbs Down" (negative) feedback to the track/media item currently playing.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.UserCancelUserInput
member.summary: When the device has requested user input "RequestUserInput>=True/1", this cancels that request "RequestUserInput>=False/0", thus allowing the user to inform the device there will be no user input given.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.RepeatState
member.summary: Specifies a Repeat State for the media player.
member.remarks: Valid values are as follows:0 = Off = Turns off Repeat mode,1 = Repeat Track/Media item,2 = Repeat All = Plays all tracks/media items.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.ShuffleState
member.summary: Specifies a Shuffle state for the media player (random play setting).
member.remarks: Valid values are as follows:0 = Off = Turns off Shuffle mode,1 = Shuffle Albums = Plays back all tracks of an album in random order and then goes the next album,2 = Shuffle All = Plays all tracks in random order.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.CurrentSearchMethod
member.summary: Specifies the search method to be used to search the slot's menu which will be used with the text input entry.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.UserInputSelected
member.summary: Sets the value of the selected item. This functionality is only available when "RequestUserInput" = False/1.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 to n , where n is equal to the number of items specified in the TextForList parameter in "UserInputParameters".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.CrestronConnectedAvrMediaPlayer.ListSearchInput
member.summary: Sets the search method to be used.
member.remarks: Supported values are:Start - seek in current list using only the first character,SubString - seek in current list rising one or more input characters.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay
member.summary: The RoomView Connected Display symbol allows any projector that integrates with RoomView to connect directly to the control system, where it can be controlled even without RoomView interaction. The symbol can be used with any projector that displays the Crestron logo.Using the projector's built-in Web page or on-screen display on some models. The following parameters must be configured on the projector: 1) the IP address of the control system; 2) the IP ID assigned in SIMPL Windows; and 3) the port number (default 41794).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.PowerOn
member.summary: Turns on power to the projector.

member.summary: Turns off power to the projector.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.ImageMuteOn
member.summary: Turns on image muting.
member.remarks: When image muting is turned on, the display is blanked out with a solid black or blue color, or (on some projectors) with a test pattern or logo screen.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.ImageMuteOff
member.summary: Turns off image muting.

member.summary: Increments the Color level by a specific percentage (e.g, 1%, 2%, or 5%, depending on the projector).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.ColorMinus
member.summary: Lowers the Color level by a specific percentage (e.g, 1%, 2%, or 5%, depending on the projector).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.BrightnessMinus
member.summary: Lowers the Brightness level by a specific percentage (e.g, 1%, 2%, or 5%, depending on the projector).

member.summary: Turns On the mute function.

member.summary: Turns Off the mute function.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.MuteToggle
member.summary: Toggles the mute function on and off with each rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.AvMuteOff
member.summary: Turns off AV muting.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.AvMuteOn
member.summary: Turns on AV muting.
member.remarks: When AV muting is turned on, the display is blanked out with a solid black or blue color, or (on some projectors) with a test pattern or logo screen. Additionally, the audio is muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the projector is online or offline with the control system; i.e. it's connected and communicating properly.
member.remarks: The output will remain high for as long as the projector is online.

member.summary: Indicates that the projector power is on.

member.summary: Indicates that the projector power is off.

member.summary: Indicates that the projector supports emergency notification.
member.remarks: The emergency broadcast is used to display emergency alerts on the connected display via the Emergency Alert Code and Emergency Message.

member.summary: Indicates that the projector is warming up.
member.remarks: The progress of the warm up time is reported by WarmingUpProgressFeedback.Some projectors are locked out during warm up.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.CoolingDownFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the projector is cooling down.
member.remarks: The progress of the cool-down time is reported by CoolingDownProgressFeedback.Some projectors are locked out during cool-down.

member.summary: Indicates that AV muting is turned off.

member.summary: Indicates that AV muting is turned on.

member.summary: Indicates that the projector is currently enabled for DHCP (dynamic IP addressing).
member.remarks: True/1 = DHCP enabled; False/0 = DHCP disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.DhcpDisableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the projector is currently disabled for DHCP (dynamic IP addressing).
member.remarks: True/1 = DHCP disabled; False/0 = DHCP enabled.

member.summary: Indicates that the User Password is disabled.

member.summary: Sets the video color level, if the display device supports it.
member.remarks: Values range from 0% (minimum level) to 100% (maximum).

member.summary: Sets the video brightness level, if the display device supports it.
member.remarks: Values range from 0% (minimum level) to 100% (maximum).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.ContrastLevel
member.summary: Sets the video contrast level if the display device supports it.
member.remarks: Values range from 0% (minimum level) to 100% (maximum).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.SharpnessLevel
member.summary: Sets the video sharpness level if the display device supports it.
member.remarks: Values range from 0% (minimum level) to 100% (maximum).

member.summary: Sets the volume level from 0% (mute) to 100% (max volume).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronConnected.RoomViewConnectedDisplay.EmergencyMessage
member.summary: The emergency message that should correspond to the EmergencyAlertCode (max 251 characters).

member.summary: Specifies the name of the room where the projector is located.
